option.name: myStatusName
option.value: Will be merged with property conflicts

task.summary: Add correct libraries to maven for databases and json . Use Jpa and eclipselink for database entities. Use jackson for json. Add persistence.xml and create tables automatically.
Remove unused columns Add a find all users method
Add a find all users method
Move angular main site under store directory Make some barebones for welcome page

======== BACKEND ======================= ~cleanup -added default contructors to all enitities -added complete constructors to all parent entities -made all entities serializable -added @Id@GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.IDENTITY) to id fields -deleted all commented annotations and imports
~json serialization handling -added id to Category entity and db -deleted all @JsonIdentityInfo annotations -handle serialization with @JsonViews(Views.WHO.class) Basic view -> all non-reference, non-id fields Internal view extends Basic -> +idFields ENTITY_NAME view extends Basic -> +all referenced by ENTITY_NAME Views are set in public static String toJson(Object obj, Class<?> view) call this enables bi-directional traversing without cycles and includes duplicate objects (fields viewable by basic) when referenced by different entities
~security -copy pasted that http://howtodoinjava.com/2015/08/19/jersey-rest-security/ -added role to user table and entities -extended name queries to search for password and username and return role -made a Generic Find static method that takes a named query and a QueryParameter list and returns a Generic list of items currently used by login service and authentication filter -added a /login path to user service to test USER role authentication -annotated @PermitAll and @RolesAllowed to respective api paths
======= FRONTEND =========================== -added sign in form functionality -sent base64 encoded pass and username on login submit through a login controller should add auth to globals or cookie or whatevs so its send along every request and clear on logOut() issue: needs a previous POST to pass authentication. -added element switch on nav bar based on user role. issue: doesnt work cuz out of scope. needs to go into a service.

MESSAGE.value: Add correct libraries to maven for databases and json . Use Jpa and eclipselink for database entities. Use jackson for json. Add persistence.xml and create tables automatically.
Remove unused columns Add a find all users method
Add a find all users method
Move angular main site under store directory Make some barebones for welcome page

======== BACKEND ======================= ~cleanup -added default contructors to all enitities -added complete constructors to all parent entities -made all entities serializable -added @Id@GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.IDENTITY) to id fields -deleted all commented annotations and imports
~json serialization handling -added id to Category entity and db -deleted all @JsonIdentityInfo annotations -handle serialization with @JsonViews(Views.WHO.class) Basic view -> all non-reference, non-id fields Internal view extends Basic -> +idFields ENTITY_NAME view extends Basic -> +all referenced by ENTITY_NAME Views are set in public static String toJson(Object obj, Class<?> view) call this enables bi-directional traversing without cycles and includes duplicate objects (fields viewable by basic) when referenced by different entities
~security -copy pasted that http://howtodoinjava.com/2015/08/19/jersey-rest-security/ -added role to user table and entities -extended name queries to search for password and username and return role -made a Generic Find static method that takes a named query and a QueryParameter list and returns a Generic list of items currently used by login service and authentication filter -added a /login path to user service to test USER role authentication -annotated @PermitAll and @RolesAllowed to respective api paths
======= FRONTEND =========================== -added sign in form functionality -sent base64 encoded pass and username on login submit through a login controller should add auth to globals or cookie or whatevs so its send along every request and clear on logOut() issue: needs a previous POST to pass authentication. -added element switch on nav bar based on user role. issue: doesnt work cuz out of scope. needs to go into a service.
